OFFICE OF THE TREASURER
Mr, William G. ^arley,
Station NHA,
University of Wisconsin,
Madison, Wisconsin.
â– Dear Bill:
Thank you for your very kind letter which I received a few
days ago. It was good of you to write me on the occasion
of my leaving the Board of NAEB. For your information, the
books are in the hands of the Auditor, Harold Hill will
drive over on the 13th to pick them up and complete the
final transfer to Utbana.
I leave active service in NAEB with mixed emotions. I am
sure that the business can be better coordinated at headquarters
than it could ever be at a member station. However this
brings to an end a number of years of service during which
I have been a Vice President, Chairman of various commltties
including the Research Committee for several years, and
Treasurer for five years. If I have been able to contribute
to the organization during these years I am happy. If I
have been able to be of assistance to you, in what I consider
to be one of the very best years NAEB has had, I am also
happy.
It has been a pleasure to work with you. I suspect that I
may have attended my last meeting but we shall see.
Best regards and Happy New Year.
Sincerely vnnrs
R. J.Coleman
